title: Home Exercise Equipment No Longer Pumped Up
sub_head: Discounted pair of Bowflex dumbbells shows that demand for home exercise equipment has returned to normal
body:
It might seem like Mr. Big’s death by Peloton in the first episode of “Sex and the City” reboot was the straw that broke the camel’s back for home fitness. Turns out, it was already on ice.
Wait times for those fancy exercise bikes are back to pre-pandemic levels, for example. An even better litmus test is the stock market, where shares of equipment companies Peloton and Nautilus have lost three quarters or more of their value even as once-idled gym chain Planet Fitness ’s stock nears an all-time high.
